Sales and Marketing+Customer Experience+.EXPLANATION: Overall satisfaction level of users with the user experience, measured through surveys or feedback on the usability and effectiveness of the UX.
Sales and Marketing+Customer Experience+.FORMULA: Average Satisfaction Score from Users Regarding UX Experience

Sales and Marketing+Customer Experience+.KPIS: Task completion rate in user interface (UI).
Sales and Marketing+Customer Experience+.EXPLANATION: Percentage of tasks completed successfully by users through the user interface, indicating the effectiveness of UI design.
Sales and Marketing+Customer Experience+.FORMULA: (Number of Completed Tasks / Total Number of Tasks Assigned) * 100

Sales and Marketing+Customer Experience+.EXPLANATION: Rate of errors made by users while interacting with the user interface, used to gauge the effectiveness of design and usability.
Sales and Marketing+Customer Experience+.FORMULA: (Number of User Errors / Total Number of User Interactions) * 100

Sales and Marketing+Customer Experience+.KPIS: User engagement metrics (time spent, pages visited).
Sales and Marketing+Customer Experience+.EXPLANATION: Metrics measuring user engagement with the product or service, including time spent on the platform and number of pages visited.
Sales and Marketing+Customer Experience+.FORMULA: Average Time Spent per User and Average Number of Pages Visited per User

Sales and Marketing+Customer Experience+.EXPLANATION: Comparison of UX/UI performance against industry standards or best practices, measured through metrics like user satisfaction and usability scores.
Sales and Marketing+Customer Experience+.FORMULA: Comparison of UX/UI Performance Metrics Against Industry Standards

Sales and Marketing+Customer Experience+.EXPLANATION: Degree to which UX/UI designs comply with accessibility standards and regulations, such as ADA or WCAG guidelines.
Sales and Marketing+Customer Experience+.FORMULA: (Number of Accessibility Standards Met / Total Number of Accessibility Standards) * 100

Sales and Marketing+Customer Experience+.EXPLANATION: Percentage of UX/UI improvement projects that achieve their goals and meet success criteria, such as increased user satisfaction or improved performance.
Sales and Marketing+Customer Experience+.FORMULA: (Number of Successful UX/UI Improvement Projects / Total Number of UX/UI Improvement Projects) * 100

Sales and Marketing+Customer Experience+.EXPLANATION: Average cost of implementing improvements to UX/UI, including design, development, and testing expenses.
Sales and Marketing+Customer Experience+.FORMULA: Total Cost of UX/UI Improvements / Total Number of UX/UI Improvements
